ACT
141
Hereditary community
Until it is determined how many parts of the inheritance right belong to individual heirs, the co-heirs manage and dispose of everything that constitutes the inheritance according to the rules according to which joint owners manage and dispose of things, except for what is entrusted to the executor of the will or the guardian of the estate.
After it has been determined how many parts of the inheritance right belong to individual heirs, until dissolution, the co-heirs manage and dispose of everything that was shared until then according to the rules according to which co-owners manage and dispose of things, except for what is entrusted to the management of the executor of the will or the guardian of the estate.
